meanings.definition: A small bag or pouch sewn into or on clothing for carrying small articles.
meanings.sent1: She put her phone in the pocket of her jacket.
meanings.sent2: He found a coin in his pants pocket.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel stored nuts in its cheek pocket for later.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a secret hidden in the pocket of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The detective found a clue in the hidden pocket of the suspect's coat.

meanings.definition: A small, secluded, or enclosed area.
meanings.sent1: The cat found a cozy spot in the pocket of the closet.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a peaceful pocket of nature in the city.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse made a home in the pocket of the old wall.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a pocket of memories, each one precious.
meanings.sent5: The cave was a dark pocket in the side of the mountain.

meanings.definition: To take or receive (money, valuables, etc.) for oneself, especially dishonestly.
meanings.sent1: He tried to pocket the extra change the cashier gave him.
meanings.sent2: The thief managed to pocket the diamond without anyone noticing.
meanings.sent3: She would slyly pocket the last cookie when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt official would pocket funds meant for public projects.
meanings.sent5: The magician could pocket a coin and make it disappear in an instant.
